Cleave

name: Accept Inevitability
rule: Score this in the third end phase if all of your fighters are out of action.

name: Advancing Strike
rule: Score this immediately when your warband takes an enemy fighter standing in enemy territory out of action.

name: Alone in the Darkness
rule: Score this in an end phase if there are no adjacent fighters on the battlefield.

name: Annihilation
rule: Score this in an end phase if all enemy fighters have been taken out of action.

name: Assassinate
rule: Score this in an end phase if your warband took an enemy leader out of action in the preceding action phase.

name: Balance of Power
rule: Score this immediately when making an Attack action if both the attacker and the target have two supporting fighters.

name: Blooded
rule: Score this in an end phase if all of your surviving fighters (at least three) have at least one wound token.

name: Bloodless
rule: Score this in an end phase if no fighter suffered any damage in the preceding action phase.

name: Brawl
rule: Score this in an end phase if all friendly fighters (at least three) are adjacent to enemy fighters.

name: Butchery
rule: Score this in an end phase if your warband took three or more enemy fighters out of action in the preceding action phase.

name: Change of Tactics
rule: Score this immediately if a friendly fighter on Guard makes a Charge action.

name: Chosen Champion
rule: Score this in an end phase if a surviving friendly fighter has three or more upgrades.

name: Complete Victory
rule: Score this in the third end phase if none of your fighters are out of action.

name: Concerted Attack
rule: Score this immediately if three or more friendly fighters made an Attack action against the same enemy fighter in this phase. (Able to be scored if you draw this card after the condition was met).

name: Conquest
rule: Score this in the third end phase if all of your surviving fighters are in your opponent's territory.

name: Contained
rule: Score this in the third end phase if all surviving enemy fighters are in their territory.

name: Cover Ground
rule: Score this immediately if a friendly fighter makes a Move action of six or more hexes.

name: Crushing Force
rule: Score this immediately if a friendly fighter makes a successful attack that deals at least twice as much damage as is needed to take their target out of action.

name: Dauntless
rule: Score this in an end phase if your fighters are outnumbered by at least three to one.

name: Defensive Strike
rule: Score this immediately when your warband takes an enemy fighter standing in your territory out of action.

name: Denial
rule: Score this in the third end phase if there are no enemy fighters in your territory.

name: Determined Defender
rule: Score this in an end phase if the same friendly fighter has held the same objective at the end of two consecutive action phases.

name: Divide and Conquer
rule: Score this in an end phase if each player has at least one fighter in their own territory and at least one fighter in enemy territory.

name: Endless Slaughter
rule: Score this in the third end phase if five or more enemy fighters are out of action.

name: Escalation
rule: Score this in an end phase if three or more upgrade cards were played in the preceding action phase.

name: Fearless
rule: Score this in an end phase if there are at least three enemy fighters adjacent to the same friendly fighter.

name: Flawless Strategy
rule: Score this in an end phase if you scored two or more other objective cards in this phase.

name: Geared for War
rule: Score this in an end phase if each of your surviving fighters (at least three) has at least one upgrade.

name: Heroes All
rule: Score this in an end phase if all of your surviving fighters (at least three) are Inspired.

name: Heroic Feat
rule: Score this immediately if a friendly fighter's Attack action succeeds when their target has two or more supporting fighters more then the attacker.

name: Hold Objective 1
rule: Score this in an end phase if you are holding objective 1.

name: Hold Objective 2
rule: Score this in an end phase if you are holding objective 2.

name: Hold Objective 3
rule: Score this in an end phase if you are holding objective 3.

name: Hold Objective 4
rule: Score this in an end phase if you are holding objective 4.

name: Hold Objective 5
rule: Score this in an end phase if you are holding objective 5.

name: Honest Opponent
rule: Score this in an end phase if you played no ploy cards during the preceding action phase.

name: Killing Ground
rule: Score this in an end phase if at least one fighter was taken out of action in the preceding action phase in enemy territory, in your territory and in no one's territory.

name: Making a Statement
rule: Score this in an end phase if you hold all objectives (at least one) in your opponent's territory.

name: Massive Assault
rule: Score this immediately if your fighters deal 7 or more damage in an action phase (damage in excess of a fighter's Wounds characteristic is included). (Able to be scored if you draw this card after the condition was met).

name: Master of War
rule: Score this in an end phase if you scored an objective card, played a ploy card and played an upgrade card in this round.

name: Masterstroke
rule: Score this immediately if an enemy fighter is taken out of action by an Attack action made as a Reaction by your warband or a Reaction made by your warband that causes damage.

name: Miraculous Escape
rule: Score this immediately if one of your fighters is the target of an enemy Attack action with a Dice characteristic of 3 or more that fails.

name: Multiple Fronts
rule: Score this in an end phase if your warband dealt damage to three or more enemy fighters in the preceding action phase.

name: No More Tricks
rule: Score this in an end phase if you have no power cards in your hand.

name: No Remorse
rule: Score this immediately if one of your fighters takes an enemy fighter out of action with an Attack action with a Damage characteristic greater than the target's Wounds characteristic.

name: Our Only Way Out
rule: Score this in an end phase if you hold three or more objectives.

name: Overextended
rule: Score this in an end phase if you hold every objective.

name: Perfect Planning
rule: Score this in an end phase if none of your fighters made a Move action in the preceding action phase.

name: Plant a Standard
rule: Score this in an end phase if your leader is holding an objective in enemy territory.

name: Ploymaster
rule: Score this in an end phase if you played three or more ploys in the preceding action phase.

name: Poised to Strike
rule: Score this in an end phase if at least three friendly fighters are adjacent to the same enemy fighter.

name: Precise Use of Force
rule: Score this immediately if a friendly fighter makes a successful Attack action that deals exactly enough damage to take their target out of action.

name: Pure Carnage
rule: Score this in the third end phase if seven or more fighters are out of action.

name: Ready for a Challenge
rule: Score this in an end phase if all remaining enemy fighters (at least three) have an upgrade.

name: Reaper
rule: Score this immediately if a friendly fighter's attack takes two or more enemy fighters out of action.

name: Scent of Victory
rule: Score this in an end phase if all surviving enemy fighters (at least three) have at least one wound token.

name: Skirting Danger
rule: Score this in an end phase if all surviving friendly fighters (at least two) are on edge hexes.

name: Stymied
rule: Score this in an end phase if your opponent played no power cards in the preceding action phase.

name: Superior Tactician
rule: Score this in the third end phase if you have scored six or more other objective cards.

name: Supremacy
rule: Score this in an end phase if you hold three or more objectives.

name: Swift Advance
rule: Score this in an end phase if all of your surviving fighters are in enemy territory.

name: Tactical Genius 1-3
rule: Score this in an end phase if you hold objectives 1, 2 and 3.

name: Tactical Genius 3-5
rule: Score this in an end phase if you hold objectives 3, 4 and 5.

name: Tactical Supremacy 1-2
rule: Score this in an end phase if you hold objectives 1 and 2.

name: Tactical Supremacy 3-4
rule: Score this in an end phase if you hold objectives 3 and 4.

name: The Bigger They Are
rule: Score this immediately if a friendly fighter takes an enemy fighter out of action with an Attack action that had a Damage characteristic of 1.

name: The Harvest Begins
rule: Score this immediately if a friendly fighter makes an Attack action that damages three or more enemy fighters.

name: Total Annihilation
rule: Score this in the first or second end phase if all enemy fighters have been taken out of action.

name: Trapped
rule: Score this immediately if an enemy fighter takes damage from a friendly fighter's Attack action because they cannot be driven back.

name: Twilight Conqueror
rule: Score this in an end phase if all of your surviving fighters (at least three) are neither in your territory nor enemy territory.

name: Unbroken Wall
rule: Score this in an end phase if all surviving friendly fighters (at least three) are in a single group with each friendly fighter adjacent to another friendly fighter.

name: Unstoppable
rule: Score this immediately if one of your fighters makes a successful Attack action against an enemy fighter on Guard.

name: Victorious Duel
rule: Score this immediately if your leader takes an enemy leader out of action.

name: Victory After Victory
rule: Score this in an end phase if you scored three or more other objective cards in this round.

name: War of Attrition
rule: Score this in an end phase if the same number of fighters (at least one) from each warband are out of action.

name: Anticipation
rule: Play this card after the final activation in an action phase. Name an objective card. If an opponent scores that objective in the end phase, score a glory point.

name: Blinding Flash
rule: Reaction: Play this during an Attack action with a Range of 3 or greater (before any dice are rolled). The Attacks characteristic of that Attack action is changed to Fury 1.

name: Confused Priorities
rule: Switch two objectives that are currently being held.

name: Confusion
rule: Choose two fighters that are adjacent to each other and switch them.

name: Cruel Taunt
rule: Choose an enemy fighter and roll an attack dice. On a roll of Smash or Critical success they are no longer Inspired, and cannot be Inspired this game.

name: Curious Inversion
rule: For the first Attack action in the next activation, Smash characteristics become Fury characteristics and vice versa, and Dodge characteristics become Block characteristics and vice versa.

name: Darkness Descends
rule: The first Attack action in the next activation has a Range of 1.

name: Daylight Robbery
rule: Roll an attack dice. If you roll a Smash or Critical success take one of your opponent's unspent glory points.

name: Death Throes
rule: Reaction: Play this card during an Attack action or ploy that will take a friendly fighter out of action. Choose an enemy fighter adjacent to the target. They suffer 1 damage.

name: Desperate Gambit
rule: When resolving the first Attack action in the next activation, you and your opponent roll off. The winner chooses whether the Attack action fails or succeeds.

name: Distraction
rule: Choose an enemy fighter and push them one hex.

name: Dual Strike
rule: One fighter supporting the first Attack action in the next activation is considered to be two supporting fighters.

name: Duel of Wits
rule: Reaction: Play this when an opponent plays a ploy. Draw two power cards.

name: Earthquake
rule: Push all fighters one hex. You must push them all in the same direction. Any that cannot be pushed this way are not pushed.

name: Ephemeral Shield
rule: The first friendly fighter to be targeted by an Attack action in the next activation has +1 Defence.

name: Flickering Step
rule: Roll eight dice. Choose a friendly fighter and push them up to a number of hexes equal to the number of Critical success rolled.

name: Forceful Denial
rule: Reaction: Play this when an opponent plays a ploy. Roll a defence dice. On a roll of Block or Critical success that ploy has no effect.

name: Fortify
rule: Friendly fighters holding objectives have +1 Defence for the next activation.

name: Frozen in Time
rule: Choose an enemy fighter and roll a defence dice. On a roll of Block or Critical success that fighter cannot make any actions or be damaged in this phase.

name: Fuelled by Fury
rule: You can re-roll any attack dice for the first friendly fighter's Attack action in the next activation.

name: Grapple
rule: Reaction: Play this after an adjacent enemy fighter makes an Attack action that drives a friendly fighter back. Push the attacker into the hex the friendly fighter was driven back from.

name: Great Concussion
rule: Choose a hex on the battlefield, then push all fighters one hex (in whichever order you choose). This push must move them away from the chosen hex. If there is no hex you could push a fighter into, do not push them.

name: Healing Potion
rule: Choose a friendly fighter and roll a defence dice. On a roll of Block or Critical success remove up to two wound tokens from them. Otherwise remove one wound token from them.

name: Hidden Paths
rule: Choose a friendly fighter that hasn't made a Move action this phase and is on any edge hex. Place them on any other edge hex. They are considered to have made a Move action.

name: Illusory Fighter
rule: Choose one of your fighters on the battlefield. Place them on a starting hex in your territory.

name: Improvisation
rule: Discard all power cards in your hand and draw three power cards.

name: Inspiration Strikes
rule: Choose a friendly fighter. They become Inspired.

name: Invisible Walls
rule: All fighters' Move characteristics are reduced to 1 for the next activation.

name: Last Chance
rule: Reaction: Play this during an Attack action that would take a friendly fighter out of action. Roll a defence dice. If the result would not normally be a success for this fighter, ignore the damage from that Attack action on this fighter.

name: Legacy
rule: Reaction: Play this after an Attack action or ploy that takes a friendly fighter out of action. Choose one of their universal upgrades and give it to an adjacent friendly fighter.

name: Lethal Strike
rule: If the first Attack action in the next activation is a critical hit, double its Damage characteristic for that Attack action.

name: Mighty Swing
rule: Your first Attack action with a Range characteristic of 1 in the next activation targets all adjacent enemy fighters. Roll for each.

name: Mischievous Spirits
rule: Taking it in turns with your opponent(s), starting with you and going clockwise, move each objective one hex. Objectives cannot be moved into a hex that already contains an objective.

name: Misdirection
rule: Reaction: Play this when a friendly fighter is chosen by a ploy. Choose another friendly fighter that could be chosen by that ploy. That fighter is chosen instead.

name: Momentary Madness
rule: Choose an enemy fighter and roll an attack dice. If you roll a Smash or Critical success make an Attack action with them as if they were a friendly fighter. Fighters do not provide support for this Attack action (in attack or defence).

name: My Turn
rule: Reaction: Play this after an Attack action or ploy that damages a friendly fighter. Push them up to one hex and make an Attack action with them.

name: No Time
rule: No more power cards can be played until after the next activation.

name: On Your Feet
rule: Reaction: Play this during an Attack action or ploy that would take a friendly fighter out of action, when there is a friendly fighter adjacent to them. Roll a defence dice. On a roll of Block or Critical success the fighter does not suffer damage and is not taken out of action.

name: Parry
rule: The first time one of your fighters is targeted in the next activation, roll an extra defence dice. When counting your successes, ignore one of the defence dice.

name: Quick Thinker
rule: Reaction: Play this after an enemy fighter's Move action. Make a Move action with a friendly fighter who has not already made a Move action in this phase.

name: Ready for Action
rule: Reaction: Play this after you upgrade a fighter in an action phase. They can make a Move or Attack action.

name: Rebound
rule: Reaction: Play this during an enemy Attack action that would succeed. Roll a defence dice. On a roll of Dodge or Critical success the attacker suffers the damage, rather than the target, and neither fighter is driven back.

name: Reflected Injury
rule: Choose a friendly fighter with at least one wound token, and an adjacent enemy fighter. The enemy fighter suffers 1 damage.

name: Rethink Strategy
rule: Discard any number of objective cards and draw that number of objective cards.

name: Sacrificial Pawn
rule: Choose a friendly fighter. If they are taken out of action in the next activation, you gain a glory point.

name: Scavenge
rule: Reaction: Play this after a friendly fighter's Attack action that takes an adjacent enemy fighter with an upgrade out of action. Gain an additional glory point.

name: Second Wind
rule: (Errata update) Choose a friendly fighter that has one or more Charge tokens. In the next activation, treat the chosen fighter as if they had one fewer Charge tokens than they have, and one more Move token than they have.

name: Shardfall
rule: Place a Shardfall token in an unoccupied hex. That hex is blocked until the end of the phase.

name: Shardgale
rule: All fighters suffer 1 damage.

name: Shattering Terrain
rule: Any fighters that make a Move action, are pushed or are driven back in the next activation suffer 1 damage.

name: Shattershard
rule: Choose an enemy fighter, and choose one of their upgrades. Roll an attack dice. On a roll of Smash or Critical success that upgrade is discarded.

name: Shifting Shards
rule: Move an unheld objective one hex. You cannot move it into a hex that already contains an objective.

name: Sidestep
rule: Choose a friendly fighter and push them one hex.

name: Spectral Wings
rule: The first fighter to make a Move action in the next activation has +2 Move.

name: Spoils of Battle
rule: Play an upgrade card. This doesn't cost a glory point.

name: Sprint
rule: Double the move characteristic of the first friendly fighter to make a Move action in the next activation. They may not make a Charge action. Once they have moved, they cannot be activated again in this phase.

name: Stumble
rule: Reaction: Play this after a friendly fighter's Attack action drives an enemy fighter back. They are driven back an additional hex in the same direction.

name: Tainted Vitality
rule: Remove one wound token from each fighter who has at least one wound token.

name: Tantalising Prize
rule: The first friendly fighter to take a Move action in the next activation can move up to an additional two hexes if they end their move on an objective.

name: Teamwork
rule: Reaction: Play this card during a friendly fighter's Attack action, before rolling any dice. Push another friendly fighter one hex.

name: Time Trap
rule: Choose a fighter. They can take an action. Skip your next activation (you cannot play this card after your fourth activation).

name: Trap
rule: Reaction: Play this during a friendly fighter's Attack action that drives an enemy fighter back. The enemy fighter suffers 1 damage.

name: Triumphant Roar
rule: Reaction: Play this after a friendly fighter's Attack action that takes an enemy fighter out of action. You can push each enemy fighter adjacent to the friendly fighter one hex.

name: Trust to Luck
rule: Discard any number of power cards and draw up to that number of power cards from your deck.

name: Twist the Knife
rule: Reaction: Play this during a friendly fighter's Attack action that has a Range of 1 and will succeed. It has +1 Damage for that Attack action.

name: A Destiny to Meet
rule: If this fighter is not out of action at the end of the third action phase, gain 1 additional glory point.

name: Acrobatic
rule: If this fighter has a Dodge Defence characteristic or has a Block Defence characteristic but is on Guard, roll an extra defence dice when they are the target of an Attack action.

name: Army of One
rule: If this fighter is the last friendly fighter on the battlefield, they have +1 Defence and all of their Attack actions have +1 Dice.

name: Awakened Weapon
rule: You can re-roll one attack dice each time this fighter makes an Attack action.

name: Blessed Armour
rule: When you roll a Critical success for this fighter when they are targeted by an Attack action, remove one wound token from them before any damage is dealt.

name: Concealed Weapon
rule: On a critical hit, this fighter's Attack actions with a Range of 1 have +2 Damage.

name: Coordinated Attack
rule: [Hex 1 Sword 2 Dmg 2] When making this Attack action, roll an extra attack dice for each other friendly fighter adjacent to the target.

name: Cunning Duellist
rule: Reaction: During this fighter's Attack action that succeeds against an adjacent enemy fighter, instead of driving the target back you can switch the two fighters' places.

name: Cursed Artefact
rule: +1 Defence, -1 Wounds.

name: Daemonic Weapon
rule: [Hex 1 Hammer 2 Dmg 3] Each time this fighter makes this Attack action, they first suffer 1 damage.

name: Dark Darts
rule:
[Hex 3 Sword 3 Dmg 1]
Cleave

name: Deathly Fortitude
rule: -2 Move, +2 Wounds.

name: Disengage
rule: [Hex 1 Hammer 2 Dmg 1] Reaction: After this Attack action, if it is successful, you can push this fighter one hex.

name: Ethereal Shield
rule: This fighter's Defence characteristic changes to Block.

name: Flickering Image
rule: Reaction: After an Attack action made by this fighter that scores a critical hit, you can push them up to two hexes.

name: Ghostblade
rule: [Hex 1 Hammer 2 Dmg 1] When rolling defence dice, only rolls of Critical success are successes for the target of this Attack action. This Attack action can never cause more than 1 damage to a target.

name: Great Fortitude
rule: +1 Wounds.

name: Great Speed
rule: +1 Move.

name: Great Strength
rule: +1 Damage to all Attack actions with a Range of 1 or 2.

name: Headlong Charge
rule: When this fighter makes a Charge action, increase their Move characteristic by 1 until the end of the activation.

name: Helpful Whispers
rule: If this fighter has no adjacent friendly fighters, rolls of Single support are a success when they make an Attack action.

name: Heroslayer
rule: [Hex 1 Hammer 1 Dmg 4]

name: Incredible Strength
rule: +1 Damage to all Attack actions with a Range of 1 or 2.

name: Katophrane's Belt
rule:
(Errata update)
Katophrane Relic
A player can only play this card by spending two glory points (instead of one) and applying the upgrade card to an eligible fighter. If this fighter has two or more Katophrane Relics, they gain the following (cumulative) abilities.
2+ Relics: Reaction: During an Attack action that targets this fighter, re-roll the defence dice.
3+ Relics: Reaction: During this fighter's Attack action, re-roll the attack dice.
4+ Relics: Reaction: After this fighter's action, draw two power cards.
6+ Relics: Action: Gain 4 glory points.

name: Katophrane's Boots
rule:
(Errata update)
Katophrane Relic
A player can only play this card by spending two glory points (instead of one) and applying the upgrade card to an eligible fighter. If this fighter has two or more Katophrane Relics, they gain the following (cumulative) abilities.
2+ Relics: Reaction: During an Attack action that targets this fighter, re-roll the defence dice.
3+ Relics: Reaction: During this fighter's Attack action, re-roll the attack dice.
4+ Relics: Reaction: After this fighter's action, draw two power cards.
6+ Relics: Action: Gain 4 glory points.

name: Katophrane's Gloves
rule:

Katophrane Relic
A player can only play this card by spending two glory points (instead of one) and applying the upgrade card to an eligible fighter. If this fighter has two or more Katophrane Relics, they gain the following (cumulative) abilities.
2+ Relics: Reaction: During an Attack action that targets this fighter, re-roll the defence dice.
3+ Relics: Reaction: During this fighter's Attack action, re-roll the attack dice.
4+ Relics: Reaction: After this fighter's action, draw two power cards.
6+ Relics: Action: Gain 4 glory points.

name: Katophrane's Hood
rule:
(Errata update)
Katophrane Relic
A player can only play this card by spending two glory points (instead of one) and applying the upgrade card to an eligible fighter. If this fighter has two or more Katophrane Relics, they gain the following (cumulative) abilities.
2+ Relics: Reaction: During an Attack action that targets this fighter, re-roll the defence dice.
3+ Relics: Reaction: During this fighter's Attack action, re-roll the attack dice.
4+ Relics: Reaction: After this fighter's action, draw two power cards.
6+ Relics: Action: Gain 4 glory points.

name: Katophrane's Locket
rule:
(Errata update)
Katophrane Relic
A player can only play this card by spending two glory points (instead of one) and applying the upgrade card to an eligible fighter. If this fighter has two or more Katophrane Relics, they gain the following (cumulative) abilities.
2+ Relics: Reaction: During an Attack action that targets this fighter, re-roll the defence dice.
3+ Relics: Reaction: During this fighter's Attack action, re-roll the attack dice.
4+ Relics: Reaction: After this fighter's action, draw two power cards.
6+ Relics: Action: Gain 4 glory points.

name: Katophrane's Plate
rule:
(Errata update)
Katophrane Relic
A player can only play this card by spending two glory points (instead of one) and applying the upgrade card to an eligible fighter. If this fighter has two or more Katophrane Relics, they gain the following (cumulative) abilities.
2+ Relics: Reaction: During an Attack action that targets this fighter, re-roll the defence dice.
3+ Relics: Reaction: During this fighter's Attack action, re-roll the attack dice.
4+ Relics: Reaction: After this fighter's action, draw two power cards.
6+ Relics: Action: Gain 4 glory points.

name: Legendary Swiftness
rule: +1 Move.

name: Light Armour
rule: Rolls of Critical success on a defence dice are no longer a success for this fighter. Roll an extra attack dice when this fighter make an Attack action.

name: Light-footed
rule: Reaction: During an Attack action that could drive this fighter back (whether or not your opponent chose to), you can instead push them one hex.

name: Low Blow
rule: [Hex 1 Hammer 2 Dmg 1] Both Furyand Smash symbols are successes for this Attack action.

name: Opportunist
rule: Reaction: After a failed Attack action that targets this fighter, you can push them one hex.

name: Regeneration
rule: At the beginning of each action phase, remove up to one wound token from this fighter.

name: Second-in-command
rule: If your warband's leader is out of action, this fighter is considered to be a leader. While this fighter is on the battlefield, opponents cannot score objectives for having taken your leader out of action.

name: Shadeglass Axe
rule:
[Hex 1 Hammer 2 Dmg 2] When this Attack action is successful, discard this upgrade. On a critical hit, this Attack action has +1 Damage.
 [Hex 3 Hammer 2 Dmg 2] After a fighter makes this Attack action, discard this upgrade. On a critical hit, this Attack action has +1 Damage.

name: Shadeglass Dagger
rule: [Hex 1 Sword 3 Dmg 3] When this Attack action is successful, discard this upgrade. On a critical hit, this Attack action has +1 Damage.

name: Shadeglass Darts
rule: [Hex 3 Sword 3 Dmg 1] On a critical hit, this Attack action has +1 Damage.

name: Shadeglass Hammer
rule: [Hex 1 Hammer 2 Dmg 3] When this Attack action is successful, discard this upgrade. On a critical hit, this Attack action has +1 Damage.

name: Shadeglass Spear
rule: [Hex 2 Hammer 2 Dmg 2] When this Attack action is successful, discard this upgrade. On a critical hit, this Attack action has +1 Damage.

name: Shadeglass Sword
rule: [Hex 1 Hammer 3 Dmg 2] When this Attack action is successful, discard this upgrade. On a critical hit, this Attack action has +1 Damage.

name: Shadestep
rule: This fighter can move through other fighters during a Move action, but must end their move in an empty hex.

name: Shardcaller
rule: At the beginning of each action phase, you can switch an objective held by this fighter with any other objective.

name: Shifting Image
rule: Reaction: After any Attack action in which you roll a Critical success for this fighter (with an attack or defence dice), you can push this fighter one hex.

name: Sixth Sense
rule: Your opponent can never consider a Double support as a success for Attack actions that target this fighter.

name: Solid Stance
rule: This fighter can only be driven back by a critical hit.

name: Soultrap
rule: Reaction: During an Attack action or ploy that takes this fighter out of action, roll a defence dice. If you roll a Block or Critical success they suffer no damage and are not taken out of action, and you discard this upgrade.

name: Sprinter
rule: +1 Move.

name: Superior Agility
rule: Reaction: During an Attack action that could drive this fighter back (whether or not your opponent chose to), you can instead push them one hex.

name: Swift Strike
rule: [Hex 1 Sword 3 Dmg 1] Reaction: Before making this Attack action, push this fighter one hex.

name: Tethered Spirit
rule: (Errata update) Reaction: During an Attack action or ploy that takes this fighter out of action, roll a defence dice. If you roll a Block or Critical success place them on any starting hex in your territory, ignore the damage and discard this upgrade (they cannot be driven back). If you cannot, they are taken out of action.

name: The Blazing Key
rule: If this fighter is holding objective 3 in the third end phase, score 2 glory points.

name: The Dazzling Key
rule: If this fighter is holding objective 4 in the third end phase, score 2 glory points.

name: The Formless Key
rule: If this fighter is holding an objective in the third end phase, score 1 glory point.

name: The Fractured Key
rule: If this fighter is holding objective 5 in the third end phase, score 2 glory points.

name: The Hallowed Key
rule: If this fighter is holding objective 1 in the third end phase, score 2 glory points.

name: The Shadowed Key
rule: If this fighter is holding objective 2 in the third end phase, score 2 glory points.

name: Total Offence
rule: (Errata update) When this fighter makes their first Attack action in an activation or power step (other than an Attack action made as part of a Charge action), you can choose for that Attack action to have +2 Dice. If you do, this fighter cannot be activated again this phase.

name: Trickster's Charm
rule: If this fighter is on the battlefield, you can play a single ploy card at the beginning of each action phase.

name: Trusted Defender
rule: You can re-roll one defence dice for this fighter when they are the target of an Attack action.

name: Unparalleled Strike
rule: [Hex 1 Hammer 1 Dmg 2] Rolls of Smash are considered to be rolls of Critical success for this Attack action.

name: Vampiric Weapon
rule: When this fighter takes an enemy fighter out of action, remove one wound token from this fighter.

name: War Cry
rule: When this fighter makes a Charge action, their Attack actions gain Knockback 1 for that activation.

name: Zealous Defender
rule: This fighter is considered to have an additional supporting fighter while they are holding an objective.

name: Invulnerable
rule: Your leader has +1 Defence for the first Attack action in the next activation.

name: Steelheart's Second
rule: This fighter's Attack actions have +1 Damage when they are adjacent to a friendly leader.

name: The Stage Is Set
rule: Score this in an end phase if the only surviving fighters (at least 2) are leaders.

name: Coveted Trophy
rule: Reaction: Play this when your leader takes an enemy leader out of action. Gain a glory point.

name: Fervent Petition
rule: Score this in an end phase if three friendly Petitioners are surviving and Inspired.

name: Warden's Call
rule: Action: Choose two friendly fighters (other than your leader) and put them on Guard.

name: Showin' Off
rule: Score this in an end phase is your leader took two or more enemy fighters out of action in the preceding action phase.

name: Impress da Boss
rule: +1 Damage for the first Attack action in the next activation made by a friendly fighter adjacent to your leader.

name: Pride of the Lodge
rule: Score this in an end phase if your leader has three or more upgrades with his warband symbol.

name: Grimnir Commands
rule: The first friendly fighter (other than your leader) to make a Move action (not as part of a Charge action) in the next activation has +2 Move. You can only play this if your leader is on the battlefield.

name: Krrk Now Leads!
rule: Score this in an end phase if your leader is out of action and a friendly fighter named Krrk is on the battlefield.

name: Krrk the Clawchief
rule: Action: Return a friendly fighter (other than Skritch) to the battlefield in an empty hex adjacent to this fighter.

name: Khorne's Chosen
rule: Score this in an end phase if your leader is the only surviving fighter.

name: Gory Visage
rule: Attack actions that target this fighter deal 1 less damage, to a minimum of 1.

name: Intervention
rule: Score this immediately if your leader takes an enemy holding an objective out of action.

name: Raptor Strike
rule: Choose an enemy fighter within four hexes of your leader. They take 1 damage.

name: Bold Advance
rule: Score this in the first end phase if your leader is in enemy territory.

name: Drawing Focus
rule: Score this immediately if your leader is chosen by three or more ploys in this phase. (Able to be scored if you draw this card after the condition was met).

name: Fearless Leader
rule: Score this in an end phase if your leader is the only friendly fighter adjacent to any enemy fighters.

name: Great Slayer
rule: Score this immediately if your leader takes three or more enemy fighters out of action in this phase. (Able to be scored if you draw this card after the condition was met).

name: Impervious
rule: Score this in an end phase if your leader is on the battlefield and was the target of three or more Attack actions in the preceding action phase.

name: Linchpin
rule: Score this immediately if your leader was a supporting fighter during three or more Attack actions in this phase. (Able to be scored if you draw this card after the condition was met).

name: Neutralise
rule: Score this in the first end phase if an enemy leader is out of action.

name: Shining Example
rule: Score this in an end phase if your leader is on the battlefield and Inspired.

name: Slayer
rule: Score this immediately if your leader takes two or more enemy fighters out of action in this phase. (Able to be scored if you draw this card after the condition was met).

name: Sufficient
rule: Score this in an end phase if your leader is the only friendly fighter on the battlefield.

name: Tireless Commander
rule: Score this in an end phase if you activated your leader with four activations in the preceding action phase.

name: Undefeated
rule: Score this in the third end phase if your leader is on the battlefield.

name: Well-guarded
rule: Score this in an end phase if your leader is adjacent to two or more friendly fighters.

name: Burden of Command
rule: Choose an enemy leader. Their Move characteristic (before other modifiers) is 1 for the next activation.

name: Cautious Commander
rule: Put your leader on Guard.

name: Commanding Reach
rule: Your leader's first Attack action with a Range of 1 that only targets a single fighter in the next activation has a Range of 2.

name: Commanding Strike
rule: You can re-roll one attack dice during your leader's first Attack action in the next activation.

name: Crippling Doubt
rule: Choose an enemy leader. The Dice characteristic (before other modifiers) of their first Attack action in the next activation is 1.

name: Final Duty
rule: Reaction: Play this during an Attack action that will take your leader out of action, before they are removed from the battlefield. Roll an attack dice. On a roll of Smash or Critical success, make an Attack action with them before they are removed from the battlefield.

name: Great Cunning
rule: Reaction: Play this after you play a power card in the power step. You can immediately play another power card. You can only play this if your leader is on the battlefield.

name: Hidden Reserves
rule: Remove one wound token from your leader's fighter card.

name: Inspired Command
rule: Choose a friendly fighter (other than your leader) and push them up to one hex or put them on Guard. You can only play this if your leader is on the battlefield.

name: Look Out!
rule: Reaction: Play this during an Attack action that will damage your leader. Roll a defence dice. On a roll of Single support, Double support, or Critical success, choose a friendly fighter adjacent to them. That fighter suffers the damage instead, then 1 additional damage, and no fighters are driven back.

name: No Retreat
rule: Reaction: Play this during an Attack action that targets your leader, after the dice are rolled. Your leader cannot be driven back by the Attack action.

name: Premonition
rule: In the next activation, you can re-roll one or more defence dice when your leader is the target of an Attack action.

name: Quick Advance
rule: Choose up to two friendly fighters (other than your leader) and push each of them up to one hex. You can only play this if your leader is on the battlefield.

name: Quick Manoeuvre
rule: Choose your leader and an adjacent friendly fighter. Switch their positions.

name: Tyrant's Command
rule: Choose a friendly fighter (other than your leader) that has a Move token. Remove that token: that fighter is not considered to have moved for the purposes of their subsequent actions. You can only play this if your leader is on the battlefield.

name: Apex Predator
rule: When this fighter takes an enemy leader out of action, gain an additional glory point.

name: Commanding Presence
rule: This fighter is considered to be two supporting fighters when it supports another fighter.

name: Commanding Shout
rule: Action: Push a friendly fighter (other than your leader) up to two hexes.

name: Cursed Shield
rule: +1 Defence, -2 Wounds (to a minimum of 1).

name: Hero's Mantle
rule: If this fighter is on the battlefield in the third end phase, gain 1 glory point.

name: Irresistible Challenge
rule: Reaction: During an adjacent enemy fighter's Attack action, before any dice are rolled, change the target of that Attack action to this fighter and discard this card.

name: Katophrane's Ring
rule:
(Errata update)
Katophrane Relic
A player can only play this card by spending two glory points (instead of one) and applying the upgrade card to an eligible fighter. If this fighter has two or more Katophrane Relics, they gain the following (cumulative) abilities.
2+ Relics: Reaction: During an Attack action that targets this fighter, re-roll the defence dice.
3+ Relics: Reaction: During this fighter's Attack action, re-roll the attack dice.
4+ Relics: Reaction: After this fighter's action, draw two power cards.
6+ Relics: Action: Gain 4 glory points.

name: Kingsbane
rule: [Hex 1 Sword 2 Dmg 3] If the target is a leader, you can re-roll one attack dice when making this Attack action.

name: Loyal Defender
rule: Reaction: After an enemy fighter makes a Move action and ends their move adjacent to another friendly fighter that is your leader, push this fighter up to two hexes. They must end the push adjacent to the enemy fighter.

name: Master of Tactics
rule: If this fighter is on the battlefield, at the beginning of the round you can draw one objective card. If you do so, discard one objective card.

name: Mighty Shove
rule: Action: Push an adjacent enemy fighter up to one hex.

name: Rising to the Challenge
rule: If your leader is out of action, this fighter has +1 Wounds and the Attack actions on their fighter card have +1 Dice.

name: Seize the Day
rule: Reaction: After this fighter makes a Move action (not as part of a Charge action) discard this card. They do not gain a Move token and are not considered to have moved for the purposes of their subsequent actions.

name: Treacherous Second
rule: Reaction: After an action or ploy that takes your leader out of action, if this fighter is on the battlefield, gain 1 glory point.

name: Trusted Second
rule: If this fighter is supporting your leader, they are considered to be two supporting fighters.

name: Tyrant's Lash
rule: Reaction: After an adjacent friendly fighter's Attack action that fails, that fighter takes 2 damage. If they survive, they can make another Attack action.

name: Blessed Banishment
rule: Score this in an end phase if your warband took an enemy leader out of action in the preceding action phase.

name: Devastating Blow
rule: Score this in an end phase if your warband took two or more enemy fighters out of action in the preceding action phase.

name: Fight as One
rule: Score this immediately if a friendly fighter makes an Attack action with two supporting friendly fighters.

name: Harness the Storm
rule: Score this immediately if a friendly fighter successfully casts a spell.

name: Heavily Armed
rule: Score this in an end phase if three or more friendly fighters each have at least one upgrade.

name: Magical Supremacy
rule: Score this in an end phase if your warband successfully cast two or more spells in the preceding action phase.

name: Measured Strike
rule: Score this immediately if a friendly fighter makes a successful Attack action that deals exactly enough damage to take their target out of action.

name: Overwhelming Storm
rule: Score this in an end phase if you have more surviving fighters than your opponent.

name: Purify the Earth
rule: Score this in an end phase if you hold an objective held by an enemy fighter at the beginning of the round.

name: Aetherwing Stance
rule: Friendly fighter have +1 Defence for the first Attack action in the next activation.

name: Chain Lightning
rule: Gambit Spell (Focus): If this spell is cast Scatter 3 from the caster's hex. Any enemy fighter in a hex in the chain suffers 1 damage.

name: Cry of Thunder
rule: Gambit Spell (ChannelChannel): If this spell is cast, choose an enemy fighter. That fighter and any fighters adjacent to that fighter suffer 1 damage.

name: Empathic Conduction
rule: Gambit Spell (Focus): If this spell is cast, choose a friendly fighter adjacent to the caster. Remove a wound token from that fighter's fighter card.

name: Gather the Storm
rule: Innate (Channel) for the next spell your warband attempts to cast. This effect persists.

name: Lightning Assault
rule: Reaction: Play this after a friendly fighter's Attack action that fails. That fighter can make another Attack action that targets the same fighter.

name: Lightning Step
rule: The first friendly fighter to make a Move or Charge action in the next activation can move through occupied and blocked hexes, but must end their move in an empty hex.

name: Safeguard Spirit
rule: Reaction: Play this after an Attack action or gambit that takes a friendly fighter adjacent to another friendly fighter out of action. Your opponent doesn't score any glory points for taking that fighter out of action.

name: Stormstrike
rule: +1 Damage to the first Attack action with a Range of 1 or 2 in the next activation.

name: Stormward
rule: Reaction: Play this during an enemy fighter's spell or spell Attack action, if the spell is cast. Roll a magic dice. On a roll of Focus that spell is not cast and is not resolved.

name: Blessed Blade
rule:
[Hex 1 Hammer 2 Dmg 2]
Cleave.

name: Corposant Staff
rule: Spell Action (Focus): If this spell is cast, choose a friendly fighter. Their Attack actions with a single target have +1 Range until the end of the phase.

name: Disarming Blow
rule: Reaction: After an Attack action made by an adjacent enemy fighter that targets this fighter and fails, roll a defence dice. On a roll of Block or Critical success, select an Attack action upgrade on the attacking fighter. That upgrade is discarded.

name: Eye of the Storm
rule: Innate (Channel)

name: Hurricane Step
rule: Reaction: After this fighter's Attack action, push this fighter up to one hex.

name: Lightning Whip
rule: Reaction: After this fighter's Attack action that succeeds, deal 1 additional damage to the target of that Attack action.

name: Stunning Blow
rule: Reaction: After an Attack action made by an adjacent enemy fighter that targets this fighter and fails, roll a defence dice. On a roll of Block or Critical success, place a Charge token next to the attacking fighter.

name: Tempest's Might
rule: +1 Damage to all spell Attack actions.

name: Unstoppable Zeal
rule: [Hex 1 Hammer 2 Dmg 1] Reaction: After this fighter's Attack action that takes an enemy fighter out of action, this fighter can make this Attack action.

name: Warding Blast
rule: [Hex 1 Sword 2 Dmg 2] Targets all adjacent enemies - roll for each.

name: As Nagash Commands
rule: Score this in the third end phase if no enemy fighters are holding objectives.

name: Death Sentence
rule: Score this immediately if three or more friendly fighters are adjacent to the same enemy fighter.

name: Drag Them Down
rule: Score this immediately if three or more friendly fighters made a successful Attack action in this phase. (Able to be scored if you draw this card after the condition was met).

name: Execution
rule: Score this in an end phase if your warband took an enemy leader out of action in the preceding action phase.

name: Swarming Spirits
rule: Score this immediately if two or more friendly fighters moved through a hex occupied by an enemy fighter in this phase. (Able to be scored if you draw this card after the condition was met).

name: Take the City
rule: Score this in an end phase if you hold all objectives on one or more game boards.

name: The Vengeful Dead
rule: Score this in an end phase if all surviving friendly fighters (at least three) are Inspired.

name: Treacherous Foe
rule: Score this immediately if your warband makes a reaction.

name: Vengeful Advance
rule: Score this in an end phase if all surviving friendly fighters are in your opponent's territory.

name: Drifting Advance
rule: Push all friendly Chainrasps up to two hexes. This push must take them closer to the nearest enemy fighter in each case. If there is more than one nearest enemy fighter, you can choose which the Chainrasp is pushed towards.

name: Endless Malice
rule: Reaction: Play this after a friendly fighter's Attack action that fails. That fighter can make another Attack action that targets the same fighter.

name: Grasping Chains
rule: Each friendly Chainrasp providing support in the first Attack action in the next activation is considered to be two supporting fighters.

name: Howling Vortex
rule: Gambit Spell (Focus): If this spell is cast, push all enemy fighters up to one hex.

name: Maddening Cackle
rule: Reaction: Play this after an enemy fighter's Attack action that fails. That fighter is no longer Inspired, and cannot be Inspired. This effect persists.

name: Rending Scream
rule: Gambit Spell (ChannelChannel): If this spell is cast, each enemy fighter adjacent to the caster suffers 1 damage.

name: Spectral Parry
rule: Choose a friendly fighter that does not have a Guard token. Place a Guard token next to them.

name: Spectral Touch
rule: The first Attack action in the next activation has Cleave.

name: Sudden Appearance
rule: Choose a friendly fighter and place them on any starting hex.

name: Vengeful Curse
rule: Reaction: Play this after an enemy fighter's Attack action that takes an adjacent friendly fighter out of action. Their attacker suffers 1 damage.

name: Chill Touch
rule: Rolls of Dodge are not successes for defence rolls made during Attack actions made by this fighter.

name: Creeping Terror
rule: Reaction: After this fighter makes a Move action, roll an attack dice for the first enemy fighter they moved through in that action. On a Smash or Critical success, the enemy fighter suffers 1 damage.

name: Curse of Unbinding
rule: Reaction: During an enemy fighter's spell or spell Attack action, if the spell is cast and the caster is within three hexes of this fighter, roll a magic dice. On a roll of Focus that spell is not cast and is not resolved.

name: Driven by Hatred
rule: +1 Dice to their Attack action when this fighter makes a Charge action.

name: Face of Death
rule: Reaction: During an adjacent enemy fighter's Attack action, before any dice are rolled, roll a defence dice. On a roll of Block or Critical success, your opponent rolls 1 fewer dice for that Attack action (to a minimum of 1).

name: Grasping Thorns
rule: Reaction: After this fighter's successful Attack action, you can push the target of that Attack action up to two hexes. They must end this push adjacent to this fighter.

name: Inescapable Vengeance
rule: When this fighter makes a Move or Charge action, instead of moving them normally you can place them on any starting hex.

name: Sadistic Strike
rule: [Hex 1 Hammer 3 Dmg 1] If the target has any wound tokens, this Attack action deals +2 Damage.

name: Shacklegheist Chains
rule: When this fighter's Attack action takes an enemy fighter out of action, gain 1 additional glory point.

name: Strangling Coil
rule: [Hex 1 Sword 3 Dmg 3]

name: Agents of Change
rule: Score this in an end phase if your warband successfully cast four or more spells in the preceding action phase.

name: Bind the City
rule: Score this in an end phase if you hold three or more objectives.

name: Chosen by Destiny
rule: Score this in an end phase if either Narvia or Turosh from your warband is on the battlefield and the other is out of action.

name: Eyes of the Master
rule: Score this in an end phase if there is at least one friendly fighter in each of the following: your territory, enemy territory, and no one's territory.

name: Harness Knowledge
rule: Score this in an end phase if the same friendly fighter has held the same objective at the end of two consecutive action phases.

name: Master of Magic
rule: Score this immediately if your warband successfully casts two or more spells in this phase. (Able to be scored if you draw this card after the condition was met).

name: Rising Inferno
rule: Score this in an end phase if you caused 4 or more damage with spells in the preceding action phase.

name: Summoner
rule: Score this immediately the second or subsequent time you use Vortemis' action to summon a Blue Horror.

name: Ultimate Change
rule: Score this in an end phase if your warband took two or more enemy fighters out of action in the preceding action phase.

name: Blessing of Tzeentch
rule: Innate (Channel) for the first spell your warband attempts to cast in the next activation.

name: Bound by Fate
rule: Choose two friendly fighters that are within three hexes of each other. Switch their positions.

name: Deceitful Step
rule: Choose a friendly fighter that is not adjacent to an enemy fighter and roll a magic dice. On a roll of Channel, place them on any starting hex. Otherwise, place them on any objective token. If you cannot, nothing happens.

name: Driven by Ambition
rule: The first friendly fighter to make a Move action (not as part of a Charge action) in the next activation has +2 Move.

name: Eidetic Memory
rule: Reaction: Play this after an Attack action made by friendly K'charik that fails. They can make another Attack action which targets the same fighter.

name: Malicious Flames
rule: Reaction: Play this during an Attack action or gambit that has dealt enough damage to a friendly Brimstone Horrors to take it out of action, but before removing the fighter from the battlefield. Adjacent enemy fighters suffer 1 damage.

name: Ravenous Flame
rule: Gambit Spell (Focus): If this spell is cast, Scatter 3 from any lethal hex. Any fighters in any hex in the chain suffer 1 damage.

name: Shield of Fate
rule: Gambit Spell (Focus): If this spell is cast, the caster has +1 Defence. This spell persists until the caster is out of action or the end of the round, whichever happens first.

name: Stolen Fate
rule: You can re-roll one dice for the attack roll of the first Attack action made by a friendly fighter in the next activation.

name: Wracking Change
rule: Gambit Spell (ChannelChannel): If this spell is cast choose an enemy fighter within 4 hexes of the caster. That fighter suffers 1 damage and 1 additional damage for each Critical success in the casting roll.

name: Arcanite Shield
rule: This fighter's Defence characteristic changes to Block.

name: Bizarre Capering
rule: +1 Defence.

name: Empowered Sorcery
rule: +1 Damage to all spell Attack actions.

name: Fateward
rule: You can re-roll the defence roll for this fighter when it is the target of an Attack action.

name: Fiery Blessing
rule: +1 Dice to this fighter's Attack actions that have a Range of 3 or more.

name: Piercing Bolt
rule:
[Hex 3 Channel - Dmg 1]
Cleave

name: Scroll of the Dark Arts
rule: This fighter's Sorcerous Bolt Attack action has +1 Range.

name: Silver Tether
rule: If this fighter is holding an objective in the third end phase, score 1 glory point.

name: Sorcerous Adept
rule: Innate (Channel)

name: Strength of Arrogance
rule: +1 Damage to all Attack actions with a Range of 1 or 2.

name: Call that a Win
rule: Score this in the third end phase if there are five or more surviving friendly fighters.

name: Dank Haven
rule: Score this in the third end phase if there are no enemy fighters in your territory.

name: Flash Finale
rule: Score this immediately if an enemy fighter is taken out of action by a spell cast by your warband.

name: Infestation
rule: Score this in an end phase if you hold every objective.

name: Mad Scurry
rule: Score this in an end phase if at least five of your surviving fighters made a Move action in the preceding action phase.

name: Malicious Kill
rule: Score this immediately if your warband takes an enemy fighter with two or more upgrades out of action.

name: Obliterated
rule: Score this immediately if a friendly Snirk Sourtongue is Inspired and takes an enemy fighter out of action.

name: Scragged
rule: Score this immediately if an enemy fighter is taken out of action while adjacent to three or more friendly fighters.

name: Vicious Killers
rule: Score this in an end phase if two or more friendly fighters made successful Attack actions that targeted the same fighter, and that fighter was taken out of action, in the preceding action phase.

name: Curse of da Bad Moon
rule: Gambit Spell (FocusFocus): If this spell is cast, choose a hex within four hexes of the caster. Any fighter in that hex or any hex adjacent to it suffers 1 damage.

name: Fungal Blessing
rule: Reaction: Play this after an enemy fighter's Attack action that takes an adjacent friendly fighter out of action. Their attacker suffers 1 damage.

name: Jealous Hex
rule: Gambit Spell (Focus): If this spell is cast, choose a fighter that has the highest Wounds characteristic on the battlefield. That fighter has -1 Wounds (to a minimum of 1). This spell persists until that fighter is out of action.

name: Little Waaagh!
rule: +1 Dice to the first Attack action made by a friendly fighter in the next activation.

name: Madcap Mushroom
rule: Innate (Channel Focus) for the next spell your warband attempts to cast. The fighter casting the spell suffers 1 damage if there are any Critical success in that casting roll, rather than two or more Critical success.

name: Make Some Noise
rule: Choose up to two friendly Squigs and push each of them up to two hexes.

name: 'Orrible Leer
rule: Gambit Spell (Focus): If this spell is cast, push each enemy fighter adjacent to the caster up to one hex.

name: Sneaky Stabbin'
rule: Gambit Spell (ChannelChannel): If this spell is cast, +1 Dice and Cleave to the first Attack action with a Range of 1 or 2 made by a friendly fighter in the next activation.

name: Sneaky Step
rule: Choose a friendly fighter and push them one hex.

name: Stab 'em in the Knee
rule: If the first Attack action in the next activation has a Range of 1 or 2, it has +1 Damage for each supporting fighter after the first.

name: Endless Whirl
rule: Action: Each adjacent fighter suffers 1 damage. Use this action only if this fighter is Inspired.

name: Extra Bouncy
rule: When this fighter makes a Move or Charge action they can move through other fighters, but their move must end in an empty hex.

name: Fiery Brand
rule: On a critical hit, this fighter's Attack actions with a Range of 1 have +1 Damage.

name: Grizzled Survivor
rule: +1 Defence.

name: Lurker
rule: Reaction: After a fighter is pushed a number of hexes, if that fighter was adjacent to this fighter before the push, push this fighter up to the same number of hexes. This fighter must end the push adjacent to the other fighter.

name: Nasty Stabba
rule: [Hex 1 Hammer 2 Dmg 2] This Attack action has +2 Dice if a friendly Prog is supporting this fighter.

name: Ravenous
rule: +1 Damage to this fighter's Attack actions with a Range of 1.

name: Sniffer Spite
rule: If this fighter is in enemy territory in the third end phase, gain 1 glory point.

name: Vindictive Glare
rule: [Hex 3 Channel - Dmg 1] On a critical hit, this Attack action has +1 Damage.

name: Volley Caller
rule: Reaction: After this fighter makes the Grot Bow Attack action, an adjacent friendly fighter makes their Grot Bow Attack action.

name: A Worthy Skull
rule: Score this in an end phase if your warband took an enemy leader out of action in the preceding action phase.

name: Blood for the Blood God!
rule: Score this immediately if three or more of your fighters made a Charge action in this phase. (Able to be scored if you draw this card after the condition was met).

name: Coward!
rule: Score this immediately if an enemy fighter begins a Move action adjacent to one of your fighters and ends it adjacent to none of your fighters.

name: Draw the Gaze of Khorne
rule: Score this immediately if your warband takes two or more enemy fighters out of action in this phase. (Able to be scored if you draw this card after the condition was met).

name: It Begins
rule: Score this in an end phase if at least one fighter from each warband is out of action.

name: Khorne Cares Not
rule: Score this in an end phase if five or more fighters are out of action.

name: Khorne's Champion
rule: Score this in the third end phase if all fighters except one of your fighters are out of action.

name: Let the Blood Flow
rule: Score this immediately if three or more of your fighters made a successful Attack action in this phase. (Able to be scored if you draw this card after the condition was met).

name: There is Only Slaughter
rule: Score this in an end phase if no fighter is holding an objective.

name: Blood Offering
rule: Choose a friendly fighter. They suffer 1 damage. Roll two extra attack dice for their first Attack action in the next activation.

name: Blood Rain
rule: All Attack actions in the next activation have the Fury characteristic, even if they would normally have the Smash characteristic.

name: Boon of Khorne
rule: Reaction: Play this after a friendly fighter's Attack action that takes an enemy fighter out of action. Remove all wound tokens from one friendly fighter.

name: Desecrate
rule: Remove one objective that you hold from the battlefield.

name: Final Blow
rule: Reaction: Play this after an enemy fighter's Attack action that takes an adjacent friendly fighter out of action. Their attacker suffers 1 damage.

name: Fuelled by Slaughter
rule: Reaction: Play this after an Attack action or ploy that takes a fighter out of action. A friendly fighter can make an Attack action.

name: Insensate
rule: The first friendly fighter who suffers any amount of damage in the next activation only suffers one damage.

name: Khorne Calls
rule: Roll one extra attack dice for your first Attack action in the next activation.

name: Rebirth in Blood
rule: Reaction: Play this after an Attack action or ploy that takes your last surviving fighter out of action. Roll a defence dice. If you roll a Block or Critical success remove all wound tokens from them, and place them on a starting hex in your territory.

name: Skulls for the Skull Throne!
rule: Reaction: Play this after a friendly fighter's Attack action that takes an enemy fighter out of action. Draw up to two power cards.

name: Berserk Charge
rule: Both Fury and Smash symbols are successes when this fighter makes a Charge action.

name: Bloodslick
rule: +1 Defence.

name: Deadly Spin
rule: [Hex 1 Sword 3 Dmg 1] Targets adjacent enemy fighters - roll for each.

name: Ever-Advancing
rule: Reaction: When this fighter could be driven back during an Attack action (whether or not your opponent chooses to do so), you can instead push them one hex.

name: Frenzy
rule: Roll an extra attack dice when this fighter makes a Charge action.

name: Grisly Trophy
rule: When this fighter takes an enemy fighter out of action, gain 1 additional glory point.

name: Terrifying Howl
rule: Action: Push each adjacent enemy fighter one hex.

name: Unstoppable Charge
rule: When this fighter makes a Charge action they can move through other fighters, but their move must end in an empty hex.

name: Whirlwind of Death
rule: +1 Damage to all Attack actions with a Range of 1 or 2.

name: Wicked Blade
rule: [Hex 1 Sword 3 Dmg 2] If you roll at least one Critical success this Attack action has Cleave.

name: Awe-Inspiring
rule: Score this immediately if your warband has taken two or more fighters out of action in this phase. (Able to be scored if you draw this card after the condition was met).

name: Cleanse
rule: Score this in an end phase if you hold all objectives in enemy territory.

name: Consecrated Area
rule: Score this in an end phase if there are no enemy fighters adjacent to your fighters.

name: Eternals
rule: Score this in the third end phase if none of your fighters are out of action.

name: Immovable Object
rule: Score this in an end phase if the same friendly fighter has held the same objective at the end of two consecutive action phases.

name: Lightning Strikes
rule: Score this immediately if an enemy fighter is taken out of action by a Charge action made by one of your fighters.

name: Seize Ground
rule: Score this in an end phase if you hold an objective in enemy territory.

name: Sigmar's Bulwark
rule: Score this in an end phase if none of your fighters suffered any damage in the preceding action phase.

name: Slayers of Tyrants
rule: Score this in an end phase if your warband took an enemy leader out of action in the preceding action phase.

name: Heroic Guard
rule: Choose a friendly fighter and put them on Guard.

name: Peal of Thunder
rule: Choose any enemy fighter and push them one hex in any direction.

name: Righteous Zeal
rule: +1 Damage to the first Attack action with a Range of 1 or 2 in the next activation.

name: Sigmarite Wall
rule: Choose two adjacent friendly fighters and put them on Guard.

name: Stormforged Resistance
rule: Friendly fighters cannot be driven back by the first Attack action in the next activation.

name: Stormforged Tactics
rule:
In the next activation, you can make the following Reaction.
Reaction: After an enemy fighter's Attack action that fails, choose up to two friendly fighters and push them up to one hex each.

name: Tireless Assault
rule: Reaction: Play this after a friendly fighter's Attack action that fails. That fighter can make another Attack action that targets the same fighter.

name: Undaunted
rule: Reaction: Play this after an Attack action or ploy that takes a friendly fighter out of action leaving one surviving friendly fighter on the battlefield. Remove all wound tokens from the surviving fighter.

name: Unstoppable Strike
rule: The first Attack action in the next activation gains Cleave.

name: Valiant Attack
rule: Enemy fighters cannot support the target of the first Attack action in the next activation.

name: Blessed by Sigmar
rule: +1 Wounds.

name: Block
rule: Action: This fighter and all adjacent friendly fighters go on Guard.

name: Brave Strike
rule: [Hex 1 Hammer 2 Dmg 2] Roll an extra attack dice if there are no adjacent friendly fighters.

name: Fatal Riposte
rule: Reaction: During an Attack action that targets this fighter and fails, roll an attack dice. On a roll of Smash or Critical success this fighter cannot be driven back and they can make an Attack action. It must target the attacker.

name: Heroic Might
rule: This fighter's Attack action gains Cleave.

name: Heroic Stride
rule: Reaction: After an enemy fighter ends their activation within two hexes of this fighter, you can push this fighter one hex.

name: Lightning Blade
rule: [Hex 2 Hammer 2 Dmg 1] On a critical hit, this Attack action has +1 Damage.

name: Lightning Blast
rule: When they make a critical hit, this fighter also inflicts 1 damage on enemy fighters adjacent to the target's hex.

name: Righteous Strike
rule: [Hex 1 Hammer 3 Dmg 2] Reaction: After this Attack action, if it failed and the target was an enemy leader, make this Attack action again.

name: Shield Bash
rule: Reaction: During an adjacent fighter's Attack action that targets this fighter and fails, this fighter cannot be driven back and you can push their attacker one hex.

name: A Worthy Deed
rule: Score this immediately if a friendly fighter takes an enemy fighter with a Wounds characteristic of 4 or more out of action with an Attack action.

name: Dark Rewards
rule: Score this in an end phase if all surviving friendly fighters (at least three) are Inspired.

name: Glory or Damnation
rule: Score this in an end phase if a surviving friendly fighter has three or more upgrades.

name: Magical Apotheosis
rule: Score this immediately if a friendly fighter successfully casts a spell that requires two or more successes.

name: Oath of Annihilation
rule: You may reveal this card at the start of your first activation in the action phase, then return it to your hand. Score this in an end phase if all enemy fighters are out of action. If you revealed this card, gain 1 additional glory point.

name: Oath of Conquest
rule: You may reveal this card at the start of your first activation in the action phase, then return it to your hand. Score this in the third end phase if all surviving friendly fighters are in enemy territory. If you revealed this card, gain 1 additional glory point.

name: Oath of Denial
rule: You may reveal this card at the start of your first activation in the action phase, then return it to your hand. Score this in the third end phase if there are no enemy fighters in your territory. If you revealed this card, gain 1 additional glory point.

name: Oath of Murder
rule: You may reveal this card at the start of your first activation in the action phase, then return it to your hand. Score this in an end phase if your warband took an enemy leader out of action in the preceding action phase. If you revealed this card, gain 1 additional glory point.

name: Oath of Supremacy
rule: You may reveal this card at the start of your first activation in the action phase, then return it to your hand. Score this in an end phase if you hold three or more objectives. If you revealed this card, gain 1 additional glory point.

name: Brutal Sacrifice
rule: Choose a friendly fighter adjacent to another friendly fighter, and an upgrade in your hand that can be applied to the fighter you chose. The other fighter is taken out of action, and the upgrade is applied to the fighter you chose.

name: Dark Destiny
rule: Reaction: Play this during an Attack action that would take a friendly fighter out of action. Roll a defence dice. On a roll of Block or Critical success the fighter takes no damage, is not driven back and is not taken out of action.

name: Enfeeble
rule: Gambit Spell (ChannelChannel): If this spell is cast, choose an enemy fighter within four hexes of the caster. That fighter's Attack actions have -1 Damage (to a minimum of 1). This spell persists until that fighter is out of action.

name: Ensnare
rule: Gambit Spell (ChannelChannel): If this spell is cast, choose an enemy fighter within four hexes of the caster. That fighter has -1 Move (to a minimum of 0). This spell persists until that fighter is out of action.

name: Fearless Strike
rule: Reaction: Play this during a friendly fighter's Attack action, before the attack roll, if that fighter has no supporting fighters. Any rolls of Single support in the attack roll are successes.

name: Glimpse the Future
rule: Gambit Spell (Channel): If this spell is cast, choose a friendly fighter within four hexes of the caster. When they next make an Attack action, you can re-roll one dice in the attack roll. This spell persists until that Attack action is made or that fighter is out of action, whichever happens first.

name: Heel
rule: Push a friendly Grawl up to a number of hexes equal to twice its Move characteristic. It must end this push in a hex adjacent to a friendly Ollo.

name: Hunting Pack
rule: Reaction: Play this during a friendly fighter's Attack action, before the attack roll, if that fighter has two or more supporting fighters. Any rolls of Double support in the attack roll are considered to be rolls of Critical success.

name: Oathsworn Attack
rule: The first Attack action made by a friendly fighter in the next activation has +1 Dice.

name: Warding Eye
rule: Gambit Spell (Focus): If this spell is cast, choose a friendly fighter within four hexes of the caster. They have +1 Defence. This spell persists until the end of the phase or that fighter is out of action, whichever happens first.

name: Chaos Boon
rule: -1 Wounds (to a minimum of 1). This fighter's Attack actions with a Range of 1 or 2 have +1 Damage.

name: Enchanted Collar
rule: +1 Defence.

name: Ensorcelled Javelin
rule:
[Hex 3 Sword 3 Dmg 1]
Cleave This Attack action has +1 Damage when made during this fighter's Charge action.

name: Grundann's Path
rule: When this fighter makes a Charge action, rolls of both Smash and Fury are successes in their attack roll.

name: Path to Glory
rule: +1 Wounds, +1 Dice to this fighter's Attack actions. You may only apply this upgrade to a fighter that has an upgrade.

name: Point-blank Shot
rule: [Hex 3 Sword 2 Dmg 1] Reaction: After an enemy fighter's Move action that ends adjacent to this fighter, make this Attack action. It must target that fighter and cannot drive them back.

name: Seized Trophy
rule: Reaction: After a friendly fighter's Attack action that takes an adjacent enemy fighter out of action, if this card is in your hand, apply this upgrade to that friendly fighter.

name: Shond's Path
rule: On a critical hit, this fighter's Attack actions with a Range of 1 or 2 have +1 Damage.

name: Theddra's Path
rule: Innate (Channel)

name: Trained Killer
rule: Reaction: During a friendly Ollo's Attack action, before the attack roll, push this fighter up to two hexes. It must end this push adjacent to the target of the Attack action.

name: Carnage
rule: Score this in an end phase if your warband took three or more enemy fighters out of action in the preceding action phase.

name: Demolished
rule: Score this immediately if a friendly fighter takes an enemy fighter out of action with an Attack action with a Damage characteristic of 5 or more.

name: Earn Your Keep
rule: Score this immediately if an enemy fighter is taken out of action by an Attack action made by a friendly fighter other than Mollog.

name: Easy Pickings
rule: Score this immediately if two or more enemy fighters are taken out of action by a single Attack action made by a friendly fighter.

name: Feeding Frenzy
rule: Score this immediately if each surviving friendly fighter (at least three) is adjacent to any enemy fighters.

name: Got Them
rule: Score this immediately at the beginning of your activation if there are three or more enemy fighters adjacent to a friendly Mollog.

name: Is It Asleep
rule: Score this in an end phase if a friendly Mollog took no actions in the preceding action phase.

name: Protect the Lair
rule: Score this in the third end phase if there are no enemy fighters in your territory.

name: Rampage
rule: Score this in an end phase if your warband took four or more enemy fighters out of action in the preceding action phase.

name: Brutal Savagery
rule: The first Attack action made by a friendly fighter in the next activation has +1 Dice.

name: Feast
rule: Reaction: Play this after a friendly fighter's Attack action that takes an adjacent enemy fighter out of action. Remove up to one wound token from the friendly fighter's fighter card.

name: Flit
rule: Push a friendly Bat Squig up to three hexes. This push can take them through occupied hexes but must end in an empty hex.

name: Follow Your Instincts
rule: Discard an objective card, then draw an objective card.

name: Hobble
rule: Choose an enemy fighter adjacent to a friendly Stalagsquig and roll an attack dice. On a roll of Smash or Critical success place a Move token next to that enemy fighter.

name: Predatory Growls
rule: Choose an enemy fighter and push them one hex.

name: Shrouded in Gloom
rule: Attack actions with a Range of 3 or more in the next activation have a Dice characteristic (before other modifiers) of Fury 1.

name: Sporeburst
rule: Choose an enemy fighter adjacent to a friendly Spiteshroom and roll an attack dice. On a roll of Smash or Critical success the enemy fighter suffers 1 damage.

name: There the Whole Time
rule: Roll an attack dice. On a roll of Smash or Critical success return a friendly Stalagsquig that has been taken out of action to any empty hex on the battlefield.

name: Wind Up
rule: +1 Damage to the first Attack action with a Range of 1 or 2 made by a friendly fighter in the next activation.

name: Blooming Spores
rule: +1 Damage to this fighter's Attack actions with a Range of 1 or 2.

name: Foul Temper
rule: You can re-roll one dice in each attack roll for this fighter's Attack actions.

name: Horrific Stench
rule: Enemy fighters adjacent to this fighter are considered to have one fewer supporting fighters (to a minimum of zero).

name: Inescapable Jaws
rule: Both Fury and Smash symbols are successes in the attack roll when this fighter makes a Charge action.

name: Jabbertoad
rule:
[Hex 3 Sword 3 Dmg 1]
Knockback 1 Discard this card after making this Attack action.

name: Regenerate
rule: At the beginning of each round, remove up to one wound token from this fighter's fighter card.

name: Rooted to the Spot
rule: This fighter can hold objectives, even though its fighter card says it cannot.

name: Spore Cloud
rule: Action: Scatter 2 from this fighter's hex. Any enemy fighters in any hex in the chain suffer 1 damage.

name: Unswattable
rule: Reaction: After an Attack action that targets this fighter and fails, push this fighter up to one hex.

name: Wrath of Living Rock
rule: This fighter's Attack actions with a Range of 1 have Cleave.

name: Collect Bounty
rule: Score this in an end phase if your warband took an enemy leader out of action in the preceding action phase.

name: Focus Fire
rule: Score this immediately if the third different friendly fighter makes an Attack action with a Range of 3 or more targeting the same fighter in this phase.

name: Headshot
rule: Score this immediately if a friendly fighter scores a critical hit with an Attack action with a Range of 3 or more.

name: It's Ours Now
rule: Score this in an end phase if two or more friendly fighters are in no one's territory.

name: Live by the Code
rule: Score this in an end phase if you did not discard any objective cards in the preceding action phase. If you do, you cannot discard any objective cards in this end phase.

name: Search the City
rule: Score this in an end phase if you hold three or more objectives.

name: Seeking Advancement
rule: Score this immediately if your warband takes an enemy fighter with a Wounds characteristic of 4 or more out of action.

name: Sound Finances
rule: Score this in an end phase if you have 5 or more unspent glory points.

name: Stake a Claim
rule: Score this in an end phase if all friendly fighters are in your territory and no enemy fighters are in your territory.

name: Aetheric Augmentation
rule: The first Attack action made by a friendly fighter in the next activation has +1 Dice.

name: Ambitious Attack
rule: +1 Damage to the first Attack action with a Range of 1 or 2 made by a friendly fighter in the next activation.

name: Atmospheric Isolation
rule: Play this only if there is a surviving friendly Thundrik. No more power cards can be played until after the next activation.

name: Prepared Position
rule: Choose a friendly fighter that does not have a Guard token. Place a Guard token next to them.

name: Protect the Boss
rule: Choose a friendly fighter and push them up to two hexes so that they are adjacent to your leader.

name: Quiet Contemplation
rule: Choose one: draw a power card, or discard an objective card then draw an objective card.

name: Seek the Skyvessel
rule: Choose up to two friendly fighters and make a Move action with each of them.

name: Timed Charge
rule: Reaction: After a friendly Drakkskewer's Move action that begins adjacent to any enemy fighters, roll an attack dice. On a roll of Smash or Critical success those enemy fighters each suffer 1 damage.

name: Toxic Gases
rule: Choose an enemy fighter. That fighter's player must make a choice: either that fighter suffers 1 damage or you push that fighter up to two hexes.

name: Unyielding
rule: Friendly fighters cannot be driven back in the next activation.

name: Ancestral Fortitude
rule: +1 Wounds.

name: Ancestral Might
rule: +1 Damage to this fighter's Attack actions with a Range of 1 or 2.

name: Augmented Buoyancy
rule: +2 Move.

name: Breath of Grungni
rule:
[Hex 3 Sword 3 Dmg 1]
Knockback 1.

name: Empowered Aethershot
rule: The Attack actions on this fighter's fighter card with a Range of 3 or more have Cleave.

name: Magmalt Draught
rule: Reaction: During an Attack action or gambit that will damage this fighter, discard this card. Reduce the damage suffered by 1, to a minimum of 1.

name: Paymaster
rule: You can re-roll one dice in each Attack roll made for friendly fighters adjacent to this fighter.

name: Punishing Retort
rule: [Hex 1 Sword 2 Dmg 1] Reaction: During an adjacent enemy fighter's Attack action that targets this fighter and fails, this fighter cannot be driven back and makes this Attack action. It must target the attacker.

name: Rapid Reload
rule: Reaction: After this fighter's first Aethermatic Volley Gun Attack action in a round, they can make that Attack action again.

name: Swashbuckler
rule: +1 Dice to this fighter's Attack actions with a Range of 1 or 2.

name: Domain Denied
rule: Score this in an end phase if no enemy fighters are holding objectives.

name: Glade's Last Hope
rule: Score this in an end phase if at least 3 wound tokens were removed from the fighter cards of friendly fighters in the preceding action phase.

name: Glade's Pride
rule: Score this in the third end phase if no friendly fighter is out of action.

name: Lithe Spirits
rule: Score this immediately if your warband makes its second or subsequent reaction in this phase.

name: Reclaim the Lamentiri
rule: Score this in an end phase if you hold all the objectives in at least one player's territory.
